channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023110467
item.description:
Report X-2023110467

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking during the unload process of a trailer and a manager was notified and package was put into a lined hazmat tote. DescribePack: One of the inner containers had a loose cap and that caused the contents to leak damaging the outer package. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was taken out of the trailer and into a lined hazmat tote and given to QA for processing.

Once it was discovered, the package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote and brought to QA DescribePack: One bottle top came loose and leaked DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bottle top was tightened down.

item.title: Report X-2023110279
item.description:
Report X-2023110279

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PROPERLY ATTIRED RESPONDER COLLECTED LEAKING PACKAGE AND TRANSPORTED IT TO PSC ACCORDING TO DECISION TREE AND PROPER METHODS. THERE WERE TWO METAL CONTAINERS IN A BOX. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL CUSHIONING WHICH RESULTED IN THE CONTAINERS BECOMING DENTED. ONE OF THE LIDS WAS LOOSE AND SEEPING LIQUID.

item.title: Report E-2023110485
item.description:
Report E-2023110485

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The spill consisted of (2) 275 gallon metal totes containing Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 (UN1993), which released from the top of both totes due to improper packaging on the totes. The terminal stated the lids on both totes were not sufficiently sealed properly, causing approximately 10 ounces combined to slosh out from both totes during transit. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they wiped up the spilled amount with Oil Dri and placed the contents into a 5 gallon poly drum. The terminal tightened the lids on both totes and moved them on to the consignee. The 5Gal poly drum of waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.
